page.title: 13MEANS OF TRAVEL IN CONNEL
page.content: Most homes in the Connel area have at least one car. The buses passing through this area are mainly the modern Scottish Citylink coaches with reclining seats and a toilet.12084 service buses go through Connel in a year while 1440 buses go and come from Bonawe. Connel Station,once an important junction,is now an unstaffed halt.On weekdays 3 trains pass in each direction between Oban and Glasgow.A new summer service between Oban and Crianlarich runs 6 times a week. On the north side of Connel Bridge is an airstrip which is used by private pilots as well as being the base for the local gliding club. Dunstaffnage Yacht Haven is becoming very popular with sailing enthusiasts.
